alert.note: Alert for Choctaw (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 13 at 9:32PM CDT until April 13 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 PM CDT FOR CHOCTAW...NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON...NORTHERN PERRY...WAYNE AND NORTHERN GREENE COUNTIES... At 931 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles east of Kinterbish to 8 miles southwest of Gilbertown to 6 miles southeast of Ovett, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Waynesboro, Butler, Chatom, Richton, Clara, Lisman, Millry, State Line, Buckatunna, Silas, Fruitdale, Pennington, Gilbertown and Toxey. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for southwestern Alabama...and southeastern Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
